summary: Calgary is the biggest city in Alberta, Canada, with over 1.3 million people living there. It's located where two rivers meet in the southwest part of the province. Calgary has a strong economy with many different types of businesses, including energy, finance, and technology. It's known for having a high number of millionaires and is considered one of the most livable cities in the world. In 1988, it even hosted the Olympic Winter Games, the first Canadian city to do so.
title: Calgary
